Summary I'm an incoming computer science masters student at Stanford with an interest in artificial intelligence – specifically, machine learning and its applications to domains like natural language processing and computer vision. I just graduated from UC Berkeley with a degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences and, this summer, I'm a software engineering intern on the MyMaps team at Google. After my time at Stanford, I'm aiming to work on data science-related software engineering projects, leveraging my specialization from my masters. Experience Acting Team Lead - BOLD Intern Program Google May 2015  – Present (4 months) Mountain View, CA As an Acting Team Lead I manage 15 summer university interns who are part of Google's BOLD Business Internship program. I am responsible for coaching them to reach our team-wide metrics, delivering actionable feedback and reporting on their performance, provide career development guidance, and leverage my network and knowledge to help make their summer internship a fruitful experience. Quality Assurance Specialist Google May 2014  –  May 2015  (1 year 1 month) Mountain View, CA As a Quality Assurance Specialist on SMB Services I audited high-touch interactions to ensure global quality standards were met. My team analyzed quality assurance trends to drive innovation and enhance total customer experience. My functional role on this team is the training lead for the North American customer support team which required designing training materials strategies to reduce quality defect rates as well as onboard new hires with an in-depth knowledge of our vast legal, workflow, and answer accuracy processes. I was also a quarterly performance coach for an average of 6 team members to assist in achievement of team wide benchmarks and peak performance from Q2-Q4 2014 before we deprecated the program. Account Strategist Google November 2012  –  May 2015  (2 years 7 months) Mountain View, CA As an Account Strategist I offered strategic marketing consultations and technical support to 80+ small and medium businesses weekly using Google AdWords, Analytics, Merchant Center and other Google products. Our team works to enhance ROI and branding for our customers, and I've exceeded in revenue targets, efficiency, and transactional customer satisfaction while holding multiple internal product specialist roles. I've been recognized for peak customer satisfaction and revenue impact targets. IT Recruiter ADVANTIS Global Services September 2012  –  November 2012  (3 months) San Francisco Bay Area As a recruiter at Advantis Global I sourced candidates through advanced Boolean searches, LinkedIn, internal network, and personal relationships. I built a robust candidate network by pre-screening candidates in competitive markets and organized candidate profiles, interview records, and client information in the applicant tracking system SendOuts. Legistative Intern United States Senate March 2012  –  June 2012  (4 months) Washington D.C. Metro Area As an intern in the office of Senator Barbara Boxer, I had multiple roles. I wrote memoranda after researching and attending Senate and House of Representatives committee hearings for Senior Counsel and Legislative Assistants on foreign affairs, healthcare, environment, and judiciary issues. I also fielded constituent calls and conveyed the Senator’s views on key legislation before Congress and compiled daily media clips and mentions for personal delivery to the Senator and archived them for the Press staff. Interns were responsible for taking constituents on tours of the Capitol which included in depth knowledge of the building's history, which was my personal favorite "project." Foundation and Government Relations Intern La Jolla Playhouse September 2011  –  January 2012  (5 months) La Jolla, CA As an intern at La Jolla Playhouse I drafted 15 grant proposals and 6 temporal budget reports for submission to private foundations and government organizations which offered funds in the $5,000-$75,000 range. While at my time there I assisted in the securing the James Irvine Foundation grant, which funded a groundbreaking theater concept titled WithoutWalls (WOW) which was launched in 2013. I also participated in regional meetings and advocacy efforts to highlight the need for arts programming with La Jolla Playhouse Trustees, San Diego elected officials, and coalitions for arts and culture. Public Affairs Intern Southwest Strategies October 2009  –  December 2010  (1 year 3 months) San Diego, CA At Southwest Strategies I had varying responsibilities in the year+ that I was an intern. One of my major projects was to evaluate two county-wide public opinion poll results regarding a global, corporate retailer and summarize findings in written reports used to determine step-by-step communication strategies by senior staff. I also assisted executive staff in facilitated discussions and meetings with community members regarding opinions, comments, and concerns over new building development proposals. I drafted strategic communication plans to meet client objectives based on internal strategies and procedures and executed ad hoc research, editorial requests, data entry, and press relation requests. Summary Hi, I am a first-year PhD student studying Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at UC Berkeley, where I hope to do research on brain-machine interfaces for the visual and motor cortex.  
 
My interests are pretty broad and span basic research, technology and new ventures. The tech industry is hard to pin down and I'm still trying to figure out where I fit into it. Although I'm focusing in on neuroengineering in the immediate future my background is all over the place and includes semiconductors, control systems, and RF and digital hardware. If you're interested in some of these things, we should chat! Please don't hesitate to get in touch with me. Summary Programmer, leader, mentor, student.  
 
I interned at Microsoft in high school on the Translate Team, and started a Computer Science club at my high school which now keeps growing.  
 
Since then, I've interned at Google on the YouTube Desktop team, this summer I am back at Google on the Search Engine team, and in the fall I will be joining Facebook as an intern.  
 
I am a rising junior at the University of Washington, studying Computer Science. This past year I served the CSE community at my school as a Google Student Ambassador and ACM leader.  
 
In the meantime I enjoy interviewing, competing in hackathons, attending tech conferences, traveling, working on my own personal projects, speaking at tech events such as the Washington STEM Summit, serving as a leader on campus, mentoring other students who wish to pursue computer science, and just being a college student. 
 
I enjoy tackling tough technical challenges, learning new skills, and meeting inspirational people both in and out of the tech industry that motivate me to work hard and enjoy the ride :)

Summary I am currently attending the University of Illinois with an RA. I work with Prof. Derek Hoiem and Prof. David Forsyth. My research lies somewhere between vision and graphics with a focus on geometric reconstruction. 
 
I graduated from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in 2012. While at RPI I was heavily involved in research with Prof. Chuck Stewart in collaboration with the HabCam group, a cooperation between NOAA fisheries and WHOI. My part of this was illumination correction for underwater imagery as well as basic substrate classification using texture recognition. Summary I am interested in experimenting with as much of Computer Science as I can, in order to find the field that is best suited for me, in which I can make a difference. 
Also, I want to connect with as many people as I can. 
 
The topics that really interest me are Machine Learning and Web Technologies. 
 
During my bachelors studies at the Computer Science I have had the pleasure of working on some great projects as a student collaborator at Google Summer of Code (Speech Recognition software), as an intern at Google (YouTube and Developers Console) and as an intern at ARIA (Romanian Association for Artificial Intelligence). It has also been a pleasure to be a member of ROSEdu and help organize and take part in their activities. 
 
I am trying to learn as much as possible and have fun at the same time by participating in hackatons or reading online articles. 
 
The technologies and languages used in my studies and extracurricular activities are Java (+ Android), Javascript, Python and Linux Shell.
